required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Assess the Effect of HDF Versus High Flux Dialysis on Free Light Chains and Cumulative Albumin Loss, in End Stage Renal Disease Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Hemodiafiltration Versus High Flux Dialysis On Free Light Chains Reduction And Its Relation To Albumin Loss.

brief_summary.textblock:
Removal of uremic toxins is the main goal of HD, It was improved by using high volume convective technique with high flux dialyzer. This technique removes medium - large molecular weight solutes giving higher dialysis adequacy and consequently improving the quality of life.
This study will assess the effect of hemodiafiltration (HDF) versus high flux dialysis on free light chains (FLC) reduction as a marker of HD adequacy and its relation to albumin loss.

primary_outcome.description: Measurement of kappa and lambda free light chains pre and post dialysis sessions, in patients undergoing high flux dialysis versus HDF.

primary_outcome.measure: High sensitive C- reactive protein reduction ratio (HsCRP)
primary_outcome.description: Measuring of high sensitive C-reactive protein pre and post dialysis sessions, in patients undergoing high flux dialysis versus HDF.

secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of cumulative albumin loss by measuring albumin spent in dialysate -hourly- in patients undergoing high flux dialysis versus HDF

arm_group.description: measuring free light chains (Kappa and lambda) reduction ratio , hsCRP reduction ratio and cumulative albumin loss on patients undergoing high flux hemodialysis session.
measuring free light chains (Kappa and lambda) reduction ratio , hsCRP reduction ratio and cumulative albumin loss on patients undergoing hemodiafiltration session.

biospec_descr.textblock:
Blood samples will be withdrawn from the arterial line at the beginning of the midweek dialysis session.
Complete blood count. Routine chemistry (S. creatinine, Blood Urea Nitrogen , S. Sodium and S. potassium, Corrected s. calcium, phosphate).
Parathyroid hormone (PTH). Free light chains (kappa and Lambda) with ELISA technique will be done to all patients before and after the dialysis session.
HsCRP will be done to all patients before and after sessions.
Albumin:
Albumin samples will be collected from the spent dialysate throughout the dialysis session; after half, 1st,2nd ,3rd hour and at the end of the dialysis session to estimate the cumulative albumin loss.
Serum albumin will also be measured for all patients.

study_pop.textblock: Participants of this study are ESRD patients on regular hemodialysis ,for more than 6 months. From Ain Shams University dialysis units.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Prevalent HD patients on regular hemodialysis sessions for >6 months 3 sessions/week of 4 hours duration.
- Patients with Arterio-venous fistula as dialysis access.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with hemodialysis catheters.
- Patients with active inflammation or infection.
- Decompensated heart failure.
- Liver Cell Failure ( Child B,C)
- Patients with known malignancies.
